The amendment to section 1311 of title 38, United States Code, increases the rate of monthly compensation for dependency and indemnity compensation. It also ensures that individuals eligible for benefits under multiple provisions of law do not face reductions or offsets in benefits. These amendments will apply to compensation paid under chapter 13 of title 38 for months beginning 180 days after the enactment of the Act. Phase-in of payment of Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for veterans who die of non-service connected disability after receiving compensation for service-connected disability rated as totally disabling for at least five years. Section 1318 of title 38, United States Code, is amended to adjust benefits for deceased veterans with continuously rated totally disabling disabilities. The amendment includes changes in payment rates based on the duration of the disability before death. The amendment to Section 1318 of title 38, United States Code adjusts benefits for deceased veterans with continuously rated totally disabling disabilities. Payment rates vary based on the duration of the disability before death, ranging from 70% to 100% of the benefits payable. The amendment reduces the age limit for remarriage of surviving spouses to maintain dependency and indemnity compensation from 57 to 55. The amendment reduces the age limit for remarriage of surviving spouses to maintain dependency and indemnity compensation from 57 to 55, with retroactive benefits prohibited before the specified effective date. The amendment allows individuals to apply for benefits within one year of the enactment of the Act.
